Description: Body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice with trace of handle root; pinkish cream slip; interior glazed streaky black with traces of two narrow bands in added red; exterior, above, trace of handle frill with painted decoration consisting of part of guilloche pattern in handle zone; below, maeander frieze between black bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 740, no. 995)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0235) (phase 2)
